description: Dashboard for MySQL Monitoring from prometheus mysql exporter.

panels.description: Disk I/O includes read or write or input/output operations involving a physical disk. It is the speed with which the data transfer takes place between the hard disk drive and RAM.
panels.title: Node Disk I/O

panels.description: Shows how much disk was loaded for reads or writes as average number of outstanding requests at different period of time.  High disk load is a good measure of actual storage utilization. Different storage types handle load differently - some will show latency increases on low loads others can handle higher load with no problems.
panels.title: Node Disk I/O Load

panels.description: Shows average latency for Reads and Writes IO Devices.  Higher than typical latency for highly loaded storage indicates saturation (overload) and is frequent cause of performance problems.  Higher than normal latency also can indicate internal storage problems.

targets.expr: avg by (node_name) ((sum(rate(node_disk_read_time_seconds_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval])) / sum(rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval]) > 0 )) or (sum(irate(node_disk_read_time_seconds_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[5m])) / sum(irate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[5m]) > 0 )) or avg_over_time(aws_rds_read_latency_average{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval])/1000 or avg_over_time(aws_rds_read_latency_average{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[5m])/1000 or avg_over_time(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_readLatency{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval])/1000 or avg_over_time(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_readLatency{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[5m])/1000)

avg by (node_name) ((sum(rate(node_disk_write_time_seconds_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval])) / sum(rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval]) > 0 )) or (sum(irate(node_disk_write_time_seconds_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[5m])) /  sum(irate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[5m]) > 0 )) or (avg_over_time(aws_rds_write_latency_average{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval])/1000 or avg_over_time(aws_rds_write_latency_average{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[5m])/1000) or (avg_over_time(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_writeLatency{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval]) or avg_over_time(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_writeLatency{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[5m]))/1000)

avg by (node_name) ((sum(rate(node_disk_read_time_seconds_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h])) / sum(rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h]) > 0 )) or avg_over_time(aws_rds_read_latency_average{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h])/1000 or avg_over_time(aws_rds_read_latency_average{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h])/1000 or avg_over_time(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_readLatency{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h])/1000 or avg_over_time(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_readLatency{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h])/1000)

avg by (node_name) ((sum(rate(node_disk_write_time_seconds_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h])) / sum(rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h]) > 0 ))  or (avg_over_time(aws_rds_write_latency_average{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval])/1000 or avg_over_time(aws_rds_write_latency_average{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h])/1000) or (avg_over_time(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_writeLatency{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[$__interval])/1000 or avg_over_time(rdsosmetrics_diskIO_writeLatency{desc="$desc",project="$project"}[1h])/1000))

panels.title: Node Disk IO Latency

panels.description: **MySQL Uptime**
panels.title: MySQL Uptime - $desc

panels.description:
**Current QPS**

Based on the queries reported by MySQL's ``SHOW STATUS`` command, it is the number of statements executed by the server within the last second. This variable includes statements executed within stored programs, unlike the Questions variable. It does not count 
``COM_PING`` or ``COM_STATISTICS`` commands.
panels.title: Current QPS - $desc

panels.description:
**MySQL Network Traffic**

Here we can see how much network traffic is generated by MySQL. Outbound is network traffic sent from MySQL and Inbound is network traffic MySQL has received.
panels.title: MySQL Network Traffic - $desc

panels.description:
**MySQL Active Threads**

Threads Connected is the number of open connections, while Threads Running is the number of threads not sleeping.
panels.title: MySQL Client Thread Activity - $desc

panels.description: This Buffer is used for Buidling InnoDB Indexes using Sort algorithm
panels.title: InnoDB Sort Buffer Size

panels.description: Combined value of Buffer Pool Read and Write requests
panels.title: BP Write Activity

panels.description: Buffer Pool Size as Portion of the Data
panels.title: Data Buffer Pool Fit

panels.description: How often buffer pool read requests have to do read from the disk. Keep this percent low for good performance
panels.title: Buffer Pool Miss Ratio

panels.description: How Much Indexes Take Compared to Data

targets.expr: (sum(count(mysql_info_schema_table_version{project="$project", desc="$desc",engine="InnoDB"}) by (schema,table) * sum (mysql_info_schema_table_size{project="$project", desc="$desc",component="index_length"}) by (schema,table)))/(sum(count(mysql_info_schema_table_version{project="$project", desc="$desc", engine="InnoDB"}) by (schema,table) * sum (mysql_info_schema_table_size{project="$project", desc="$desc",component="data_length"}) by (schema,table)))

panels.title: Indexing Overhead

panels.description: Current Number of InnoDB Tables in database
panels.title: InnoDB Tables

panels.description: If Enabled, By Default every Table will have its own Tablespace represented as its own .idb file  rather than all tables stored in single system tablespace
panels.title: InnoDB File Per Table

panels.description: Total Amount of Space Allocated.    May not exactly match amount of space used on file system but provided great guidance
panels.title: Space Allocated

panels.description: Space used in All  InnoDB Tables.   Reported Allocated Space Less Free Space
panels.title: Space Used

panels.description: Space Used by Data (Including Primary Key)
panels.title: Data Length

panels.description: Space Used by Secondary Indexes
panels.title: Index Length

panels.description: How Much Space is Free. Too high value wastes space on disk
panels.title: Free

panels.description: Estimated number of Rows in InnoDB Storage Engine. It is not exact value and it can change abruptly as information is updated
panels.title: Estimated Rows

panels.description: Amount of Data Per Row

targets.expr: sum(count(mysql_info_schema_table_version{project="$project", desc="$desc",engine="InnoDB"}) by (schema,table) * sum(mysql_info_schema_table_size{project="$project", desc="$desc",component="data_length"}) by (schema,table)) / (sum(count(mysql_info_schema_table_version{project="$project", desc="$desc",engine="InnoDB"}) by (schema,table) * sum (mysql_info_schema_table_rows{project="$project", desc="$desc"}) by (schema,table)))

panels.title: Data Size Per Row

panels.description: Index Size Per Row shows how much space we're using for indexes on per row basics

targets.expr: sum(count(mysql_info_schema_table_version{project="$project", desc="$desc",engine="InnoDB"}) by (schema,table) * sum(mysql_info_schema_table_size{project="$project", desc="$desc",component="index_length"}) by (schema,table)) / (sum(count(mysql_info_schema_table_version{project="$project", desc="$desc",engine="InnoDB"}) by (schema,table) * sum (mysql_info_schema_table_rows{project="$project", desc="$desc"}) by (schema,table)))

panels.title: Index Size Per Row
Portion of Buffer Pool To Dump/Load

panels.description: InnoDB automatically optimized for Dedicated Server Environment (auto scaling cache and some other variables)
panels.title: InnoDB Dedicated Server

panels.description: Refresh InnoDB Statistics when meta-data queries by SHOW TABLE STATUS or INFORMATION_SCHEMA queries.  If Enabled can cause severe performance issues
panels.title: Update Stats when Metadata Queried

panels.description: Number of Pages To Sample if Persistent Statistics are Enabled
panels.title: InnoDB Persistent Sample Pages

panels.description: Number of Pages To Sample if Persistent Statistics are Disabled
panels.title: InnoDB Transient Sample Pages

targets.expr: avg by (desc,state) (max_over_time(mysql_global_status_buffer_pool_pages{project="$project", desc="$desc", state=~"free|data|misc"}[$__interval]) or max_over_time(mysql_global_status_buffer_pool_pages{project="$project", desc="$desc", state=~"free|data|misc"}[5m]))

matcher.options: Paged Fetched by Random Read Ahead
Paged Fetched by Read Ahead but Never Accessed

targets.legendFormat: Pages Fetched by Linear Read Ahead
Paged Fetched by Random Read Ahead
Paged Fetched by Read Ahead but Never Accessed

matcher.options: Paged Fetched by Random Read Ahead
Paged Fetched by Read Ahead but Never Accessed

panels.description:
**InnoDB Row Operations**

This graph allows you to see which operations occur and the number of rows affected per operation. A graph like Queries Per Second will give you an idea of queries, but one query could effect millions of rows.
panels.title: InnoDB Row Reads

panels.description:
**InnoDB Row Operations**

This graph allows you to see which operations occur and the number of rows affected per operation. A graph like Queries Per Second will give you an idea of queries, but one query could effect millions of rows.

matcher.options: Paged Fetched by Random Read Ahead
Paged Fetched by Read Ahead but Never Accessed

panels.title: InnoDB Row Writes

panels.description:
** InnoDB Lock Wait Timeout **
How long to wait for row lock before timing out
panels.title: Lock Wait Timeout

panels.description: If Disabled InnoDB Will not detect deadlocks but rely on timeouts
panels.title: InnoDB Deadlock Detection

panels.description: Will Define How mush locking will come from working with Auto Increment Columns
panels.title: InnoDB Auto Increment Lock Mode

panels.description: Whenever to rollback all transaction on timeout or just last statement
panels.title: Rollback on Timeout

panels.description: Percent of Active Sections which are blocked due to waiting on InnoDB Row Locks
panels.title: Row Lock Blocking

panels.description: Average Number of Sessions blocked from proceeding due to waiting on row level lock
panels.title: InnoDB Row Lock Wait Load

panels.description: Note: Due to difference in timing of Row Write and Data Write the value may be misleading on short intervals
panels.title: Data Written Per Row Written

panels.description:
**InnoDB I/O**

_Data Writes_ - The total number of InnoDB data writes._Data Reads_ - The total number of InnoDB data reads (OS file reads)._Log Writes_ - The number of physical writes to the InnoDB redo log file._Data Fsyncs_ - The number of fsync() operations. The frequency of fsync() calls is influenced by the setting of the `innodb_flush_method` configuration option.
panels.title: InnoDB Log IO

title: MySQL 8.0 Overview
